docs.title: Java Learning Platform
docs.text: Welcome to the Java Learning Platform - a comprehensive resource for Java developers covering core concepts to advanced microservices architecture.

docs.title: Java Core
docs.text:
• Basic Concepts and Syntax
  • Object-Oriented Programming
  • Collections Framework
  • Exception Handling
  • Multithreading
  • File I/O
  • Lambda Expressions and Streams
  • Java Modules

docs.title: Spring Boot
docs.text:
• Core Concepts
  • Dependency Injection
  • Web Applications
  • Data Access
  • Security
  • Testing
  • Actuator
  • Deployment
  • AOP
  • Configuration
  • Spring Data JPA
  • Spring Data MongoDB
  • Spring Kafka Integration
  • Spring AI
  • Best Practices

docs.title: Microservices
docs.text:
• Basic Concepts and Architecture
  • Communication Patterns
  • Service Discovery
  • Resilience Patterns
  • API Gateway
  • Security
  • Monitoring
  • Deployment
  • Testing
  • Best Practices
  • Saga Pattern
  • CQRS Pattern
  • Platform Architecture

docs.title: Kubernetes
docs.text:
• Basic Concepts and Architecture
  • Deployment and Services
  • Storage Management
  • Scaling and Autoscaling
  • Monitoring and Logging
  • Security and RBAC
  • Networking and Ingress
  • Troubleshooting
  • Best Practices

docs.title: Design Patterns
docs.text:
• Creational Patterns
  • Structural Patterns
  • Behavioral Patterns
  • Integration Patterns
  • Cloud Patterns

docs.title: How to Use This Platform
docs.text: This learning platform is designed to be flexible and accommodate different learning styles:

docs.title: Structured Learning Path
docs.text: For those new to Java or wanting a comprehensive education, we recommend following the sections in order: 1. Java Core 2. Spring Boot 3. Design Patterns 4. Microservices 5. Kubernetes

docs.title: Reference Guide
docs.text: Experienced developers can use this platform as a reference by directly accessing specific topics of interest.

docs.title: Practical Application
docs.text: Each section includes practical examples and exercises to reinforce learning. Code samples can be found in the examples directory.

docs.title: Search Documentation
docs.text: To find specific topics quickly, use the search functionality available at the top of each page.

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text: We welcome contributions to improve this learning platform. See our contribution guidelines for more details.

docs.title: Deployment
docs.text: This documentation is deployed using GitHub Pages and can be accessed at https://yourorganization.github.io/java-learning/.

docs.title: Feedback
docs.text: Your feedback is valuable to us! Please submit your comments and suggestions through our feedback form or open an issue in our GitHub repository.

docs.title: License
docs.text: This learning platform is licensed under the MIT License.

docs.title: Contributing to Java Learning Platform
docs.text: Thank you for your interest in contributing to the Java Learning Platform! This document provides guidelines and instructions for contributing to our documentation.

docs.title: Ways to Contribute
docs.text:
There are several ways you can contribute to the Java Learning Platform:

  1. Content Improvements: Correct errors, clarify explanations, or expand on existing content
  2. New Content: Add new topics or sections that are missing
  3. Code Examples: Improve or add new code examples
  4. Technical Improvements: Enhance the platform's functionality, search capabilities, etc.
  5. Feedback: Provide feedback on existing content

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• GitHub account
  • Git installed locally
  • Basic knowledge of Markdown
  • Python 3.8+ for local testing

docs.title: Setup Process
docs.text:
1. Fork the repository
  2. Clone your fork locally 
    git clone https://github.com/mshemeel/java-learning.git
cd java-learning
  3. Install dependencies 
    pip install -r requirements.txt
  4. Run the documentation locally 
    mkdocs serve

docs.title: Contribution Workflow
docs.text:
1. Create a new branch for your work 
    git checkout -b feature/your-feature-name
  2. Make your changes
  3. Test your changes locally using mkdocs serve
  4. Commit your changes with a clear commit message 
    git commit -am "Add explanation of Spring Boot profiles"
  5. Push your changes to your fork 
    git push origin feature/your-feature-name
  6. Create a pull request from your fork to the main repository

docs.title: Style and Formatting
docs.text:
• Use clear, concise language
  • Follow the existing document structure
  • Use proper Markdown formatting
  • Include code examples where appropriate
  • Ensure code examples are correct and runnable

docs.title: Adding New Content
docs.text:
1. Create new Markdown files in the appropriate subdirectory
  2. Update the nav section in mkdocs.yml to include your new file
  3. Ensure your content includes:
  4. Clear introduction
  5. Well-structured content with proper headings
  6. Code examples where applicable
  7. References or further reading

docs.title: Review Process
docs.text:
All contributions go through the following review process:

  1. Initial review by maintainers
  2. Technical accuracy verification
  3. Style and formatting check
  4. Feedback and suggested changes
  5. Final approval and merge

docs.title: Code of Conduct
docs.text: Please note that this project adheres to a Code of Conduct. By participating, you are expected to uphold this code.

docs.title: Questions?
docs.text:
If you have any questions or need help with the contribution process, please open an issue on GitHub or contact the maintainers directly.

Thank you for contributing to the Java Learning Platform!

docs.title: Feedback
docs.text: We value your feedback on the Java Learning Platform. Your input helps us improve our content and user experience.

docs.title: Quick Feedback
docs.text:
Was this documentation helpful to you?

👍 Yes 👎 No

docs.title: Detailed Feedback
docs.text:
Please let us know what we can improve:

Which section are you providing feedback on? Please select Java Core Spring Boot Microservices Kubernetes Design Patterns Overall Platform What type of feedback are you providing? Please select Technical error or correction Suggestion for improvement Missing content Positive feedback Question Other Please provide your feedback: Your email (optional, if you'd like us to follow up): Submit Feedback

docs.title: GitHub Issues
docs.text:
You can also provide feedback by opening an issue in our GitHub repository:

Report an issue

Thank you for helping us improve the Java Learning Platform!
